instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no power.

It puls 5.15V and 0.05A from ampmeter, but only with one side of the USB. Already tried new power flex cable but with same result.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.59V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.59V
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_E85</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> = 2.940V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.2V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H_LDO</SIGNAL> = 4.9V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 4.9V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.2V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> = 1.055V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.2V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.420 on diode reading.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Any history available?

I do not recommend bothering with this MLB.
All of them end with dead CPU.
Then client comes back to you, even your repair wasn't CPU related...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Client says it stoped working. He shut it down at night, and in the morning it was dead.

Is there any way to be sure it is CPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all coils; compare with good board.
Difficult to diagnose CPU, if you don't get some bad readings related with CPU.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,  

diode mode to ground on all coils is identical with other board. 

Is there anything else I can do?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Any S3 voltage present?
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
What about <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V

No S3 line has voltage present.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  = 0V

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>  = 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: No reaction on them when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
yes,  

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> drops from 3.2V to 0.358V, when triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Then PCH problem.
Check its RTC signals, if you want to spend more time.
